Overview.Summary: The 2023 Latvian presidential election resulted in the election of Edgars Rinkēvičs as the new president (1,3,10). Rinkēvičs had previously served as the country's longest-serving Foreign Minister and made better access of the President's institution to Latvian society a priority (3,6). His candidacy was officially launched at the Ford Foundation Center in New York (6). The election took place on May 31, 2023 (1,10) and was a tight vote (10). Rinkēvičs spoke during a press conference in Riga, Latvia on May 31, 2023 (5). The new president submitted his government's resignation to President Edgars Rinkevics on August 17, 2023 (8). The country has also been working towards Nato and EU membership (9).

Overview.Summary: The 2023 Latvian presidential election saw the election of Edgars Rinkevics as the new president (1). Latvia's current president, Egils Levits, was also mentioned in an article about his address to the European Parliament (2). The 2024 election was also discussed, with potential questions about the next president (5) and a ranking of past U.S. presidents (7). Other elections in 2024, such as in Indonesia (6) and Finland (8), were also mentioned. Additionally, the 2014 European Parliament elections in Latvia were mentioned (9). The election in Madagascar in 2023 was also briefly discussed (10).

Timeline.Text: Edgars Rinkevics is elected as the new president of Latvia by the Latvian Parliament.
Félix Tshisekedi is declared the winner of the Democratic Republic of Congo's election, despite accusations of fraud from several opposition candidates.
Vladimir Putin announces his intention to run for president again in the 2024 Russian presidential election.
Former Prime Minister Alexander Stubb wins Finland's presidential election, defeating Green Party member Pekka Haavisto.
Indonesia's presidential election sees strong voter mobilization, despite concerns about the country's democratic institutions.
Presidential experts rank Joe Biden and Donald Trump among the best and worst U.S. presidents, respectively.
10 questions are raised about the upcoming 2024 U.S. presidential election.
Latvia's eight candidates for the European Parliament are elected.
Andry Rajoelina is re-elected as the president of Madagascar, despite accusations of irregularities from the opposition.

Overview.Summary: In the 2023 Latvian presidential election, Petr Pavel defeated Andrej Babis (1). In 2019, Egils Levits was elected as the tenth president of Latvia (2). In Finland's 2024 presidential election, Alexander Stubb won by a small margin (3). Taiwan's ruling Democratic Progressive Party won its third consecutive presidential election in 2024 (4). In the Democratic Republic of Congo's 2023 presidential election, Felix Tshisekedi was declared the winner (5). In the Netherlands' 2023 election, Geert Wilders' far-right PVV party received 35 seats (6). In Indonesia's 2024 presidential election, Prabowo Subianto held a commanding lead (7). In Liberia's 2023 presidential election, Joseph Boakai conceded defeat to George Weah (8). Taiwan's 2023 presidential election was a three-way race (9). In Sierra Leone's 2023 presidential election, President George Weah won a close race (10).

Timeline.Text: Political novice Petr Pavel defeats populist business tycoon Andrej Babis in the first of several important European elections.
The far-right PVV, led by Geert Wilders, is projected to win the Dutch election.
The final candidates for Taiwan's presidential election are determined.
Opposition candidate Joseph Boakai concedes defeat to George Weah in the Liberian presidential election.
Felix Tshisekedi is declared the winner of the presidential election in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
Taiwan's ruling Democratic Progressive Party wins a historic third consecutive presidential victory.
Alexander Stubb is projected to win Finland's presidential election by a narrow margin.
Defense Minister Prabowo Subianto holds a commanding lead in Indonesia's presidential election, according to unofficial vote counts.
Egils Levits is inaugurated as the tenth president of Latvia.
Felix Tshisekedi is declared the winner of the presidential election in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

Overview.Summary: The 2023 Latvian presidential election will take place on a date in late May or early June (1). The election process involves a vote at the Saeima, the Latvian parliament (1). The current incumbent, Egils Levits, will leave office on July 8 (1). The election is similar to the US presidential election, which also takes place in 2024 (2,5). In Singapore, eligible voters are required by law to vote in elections (3). In Liberia, the 2023 presidential election will take place amid growing anger over corruption and the cost of living (6). The election cycle for the US presidential election begins as early as two years before the general election (7). The candidates for the 2024 US presidential election will participate in debates starting in late 2023 (8). The election process involves primaries, which vary by state and can be open or closed (9). After the 2020 US presidential election, some states reworked their mail-in ballot processes to deliver results faster (10).

Overview.Summary: Edgars Rinkevics was elected as the new president of Latvia in the 2023 Latvian presidential election (1,2). He will succeed Egils Levits, who did not run for a second term (4). Rinkevics is a former foreign minister and has previously served as Latvia's ambassador to several countries (5). In the 2024 election, Latvia's three-way contest for president will include former GIC chief investment officer Ng Kok Song (14). Additionally, Latvia's prime minister has stated that the Baltic states are seeking a unified position on the upcoming Russian presidential elections (18).

Timeline.Text: Madagascar holds the first round of its presidential election, with Andry Rajoelina elected as president despite opposition boycotts.
Democratic Republic of Congo holds its presidential election, resulting in the re-election of President Felix Tshisekedi.
Latvian President Egils Levits visits the judges of the Supreme Court of the Netherlands to discuss fundamental rights and the limits of legislative discretion.
Petr Pavel is elected as the president of the Czech Republic in the first of several important European elections.
Latvian Prime Minister Evika Silina states that the Baltic states are seeking a unified position on the upcoming Russian presidential elections.
The 2024 U.S. presidential election takes place, with Joe Biden and Donald Trump being ranked as the best and worst presidents respectively by presidential experts.
Nearly 40 million Congolese voters go to the polls for the Democratic Republic of Congo's presidential election.
The European Parliamentary elections are held across the 27 EU member states.
Singapore holds its ninth presidential election, with former GIC chief investment officer Ng Kok Song, Tharman Shanmugaratnam, and Tan Kin Lian as candidates.
Singaporeans head to the polls for the first contested presidential election in over a decade.
Madagascar holds the second round of its presidential election, with Andry Rajoelina re-elected as president.
Russian President Vladimir Putin announces that he will run for re-election in the 2024 Russian presidential election.
